name: unstrained
content:
unstrained adjective
(LIQUID)
Add to word list
Add to word list
Unstrained food or drink has not been passed through a device with holes in order to separate solids and liquids or in order to make a thick, smooth liquid: Using unstrained fat will result in low-quality chips. Shake the cocktail and pour it unstrained into a glass.

Cookery terms
unstrained adjective
(PRESSURE)
not forced, not put under pressure, or not involving a lot of effort: The transition from singing low notes to singing high notes should be smooth and unstrained. She gave her a warm and unstrained smile.
More examplesFewer examplesIt seemed his patience was unstrained. Treatment involves restoring the jaw to its unstrained position.
